issues.title: Create account in blockchain wallet
issues.body:
Using api-v1-client I have created multiple wallet like wallet1,wallet2..etc. Now I want to send bitcoin from my wallet1 to wallet2 and consider my wallet1 having 10 bitocin balance. But when i try to send bitcoin from wallet1 to wallet2 at that time it'll give me error like : 

Fatal error: Uncaught exception 'Blockchain\Exception\ApiError' with message 'Error building transaction' in 

Also open the ticket on support of blockchain.info and their reply is : 

You may have many small amounts of bitcoin in many addresses in the wallet (which you would need to try and consolidate to send normally).

Can you try making a new account in your wallet, and then transferring all funds in your wallet to this new account. Then, in your api call, add an &from=1 (to denote the second account in your wallet that you just created). Or, if this is the third account in the wallet, it would be &from=2

So Now my question is that how to create account in my wallet using api..?

Sorry about that. Can you explain why this didn't work, and what your solution was? The idea is to run this alongside service-my-wallet-v3 running locally, in which case the code above should work.
Yes - that is the correct solution. Thanks! Would you like to submit a PR with that change?

Thanks, however I have had another look this morning, and it seems that the solution should be leaving `Blockchain.php` as it is, but changing the following line in `Create.php`:

`return new WalletResponse($this->blockchain->post('api/v2/create_wallet', $params));`

to:

`return new WalletResponse($this->blockchain->post('api/v2/create', $params));`

Can you please confirm whether this works for you, and update the PR?
Merged. Thank you once again for your help.
Congrats!
The API clients do not support ether at this time.

issue_comments.body:
Hi, 
I have encountered the same problem. After contacting the support and a few tests I think I have found the cause for this. Regarding the instructions you should set your service url like "http://localhost:3000", but you need to enter a slash at the end like "http://localhost:3000/". The Library connects to "http://localhost:3000merchant/..." instead of "http://localhost:3000/merchant/...". This is a silly solution so I changed the setServiceUrl function to add a slash if missing. I also added a pull request for this. Maybe this will help you.

 #42 

kind regards,
Montymort

issue_comments.body: Your transaction size may have been too small. Please see https://github.com/blockchain/My-Wallet/issues/111
Docs have been updated to reflect minimum transaction size of 0.005 BTC for public notes.

Please describe how this relates to the PHP client library. 

Some screenshots might help, as well.
`__DIR__` was implemented in PHP 5.3.0, but this patch allows backwards compatibility beyond that.
Thanks so much!
Did you install the library with Composer?
The receive API endpoint does not add addresses to your wallet. Rather, it forwards all funds send to the `input_address` to the `destination` address you specified.
I believe this is an issue with the API itself, not the PHP client library. I have forwarded this issue to the dev team.
Are you using Composer to install the API library?
What API call are you making, and how fast are you making requests?

issue_comments.body: is there any ETA for this?

Sorry if I misunderstood but you want me to make this possible?

If so I'll fork it and start working.

EDIT: I saw that you have merged a composer.json but it is not enough. You have to implement namespaces all over file with classes.

Here is a good link: http://jessesnet.com/development-notes/2014/php-composer-autoloading/

All php file which contains a class needs a namespace. These files only contains the class.
I think we can specify the 'lib' directory as the source, it is a configuration on the composer.json file.

I could make the changes, you will get a merge request soon.

A structures of data that can be use as a guide to the begginer; just like me. :)

<?php
/\* vim: set expandtab tabstop=4 shiftwidth=4 softtabstop=4: */

/**
- Short File Description
  *
- PHP version 5
  *
- @category   aCategory
- @package    aPackage
- @subpackage aSubPackage
- @author     anAuthor
- @copyright  2014 a Copyright
- @license    a License
- @link       http://www.aLink.com
  */

namespace Blockchain;

use \Blockchain\Exception\Error;
use \Blockchain\Exception\ApiError;
use \Blockchain\Exception\HttpError;

use \Blockchain\Create\Create;
use \Blockchain\Explorer\Explorer;
use \Blockchain\PushTX\Push;
use \Blockchain\Rates\Rates;
use \Blockchain\Receive\Receive;
use \Blockchain\Stats\Stats;
use \Blockchain\Wallet\Wallet;

// Check if BCMath module installed
if(!function_exists('bcscale')) {
    throw new Error("BC Math module not installed.");
}

// Check if curl module installed
if(!function_exists('curl_init')) {
    throw new Error("cURL module not installed.");
}

class Blockchain {
    const URL = 'https://blockchainbdgpzk.onion/';

```
private $ch;
private $api_code = null;

const DEBUG = true;
public $log = Array();

public function __construct($api_code=null) {
    if(!is_null($api_code)) {
        $this->api_code = $api_code;
    }

    $this->ch = curl_init();
    curl_setopt($this->ch, CURLOPT_USERAGENT, 'Blockchain-PHP/1.0');
    curl_setopt($this->ch, CURLOPT_HEADER, false);
    curl_setopt($this->ch, CURLOPT_RETURNTRANSFER, true);
    curl_setopt($this->ch, CURLOPT_CONNECTTIMEOUT, 30);
    curl_setopt($this->ch, CURLOPT_TIMEOUT, 60);
    curl_setopt($this->ch, CURLOPT_CAINFO, dirname(__FILE__).'/Blockchain/ca-bundle.crt');

    //Tor
    curl_setopt($this->ch, CURLOPT_PROXY, 'localhost:9050');
    curl_setopt($this->ch, CURLOPT_PROXYTYPE, 7);

    $this->Create   = new Create($this);
    $this->Explorer = new Explorer($this);
    $this->Push     = new Push($this);
    $this->Rates    = new Rates($this);
    $this->Receive  = new Receive($this);
    $this->Stats    = new Stats($this);
    $this->Wallet   = new Wallet($this);
}

public function __destruct() {
    curl_close($this->ch);
}

public function setTimeout($timeout) {
    curl_setopt($this->ch, CURLOPT_TIMEOUT, intval($timeout));
}

public function post($resource, $data=null) {
    curl_setopt($this->ch, CURLOPT_URL, self::URL.$resource);
    curl_setopt($this->ch, CURLOPT_POST, true);

    curl_setopt($this->ch, CURLOPT_HTTPHEADER, 
        array("Content-Type: application/x-www-form-urlencoded"));

    if(!is_null($this->api_code)) {
        $data['api_code'] = $this->api_code;
    }

    curl_setopt($this->ch, CURLOPT_POSTFIELDS, http_build_query($data));

    $json = $this->_call();

    // throw ApiError if we get an 'error' field in the JSON
    if(array_key_exists('error', $json)) {
        throw new ApiError($json['error']);
    }

    return $json;
}

public function get($resource, $params=null) {
    curl_setopt($this->ch, CURLOPT_POST, false);

    if(!is_null($this->api_code)) {
        $params['api_code'] = $this->api_code;
    }
    curl_setopt($this->ch, CURLOPT_HTTPHEADER, array());

    $query = http_build_query($params);
    curl_setopt($this->ch, CURLOPT_URL, self::URL.$resource.'?'.$query);

    return $this->_call();
}

private function _call() {      
    $t0 = microtime(true);
    $response = curl_exec($this->ch);
    $dt = microtime(true) - $t0;

    if(curl_error($this->ch)) {
        $info = curl_getinfo($this->ch);
        throw new HttpError("Call to " . $info['url'] . " failed: " . curl_error($this->ch));
    }
    $json = json_decode($response, true);
    if(is_null($json)) {
        throw new Error("Able to decode JSON response from Blockchain: " . $response);
    }

    if(self::DEBUG) {
        $info = curl_getinfo($this->ch);
        $this->log[] = array(
            'curl_info' => $info,
            'elapsed_ms' => round(1000*$dt)
        );
    }

    return $json;
}
```

}

I found my problem, maybe you have the same.
In my case i was using my Blockchain address that they give when we login, but that is not the key.
The key is the Identifier the one you use to login.

Good luck!

First, make a wallet on Blockchain, then you will get an email telling that this is your Login Link: https://blockchain.info/wallet/indentifier_goes_here
Now you have the identifier and the password is the one you wrote when you created the account.

Now that the API knows you by the identifier and the password you can make requests.

If you use api-v1-client-php library then you don't need to know the url structure, just the functions that are there to make it all easy.
But for the url structures, take a look here: https://blockchain.info/api
API key is not mandatory, you can request a api key only when you start to have more requests then normal. If you insist on getting a API Key and still no answer in 48 hours then use https://blockchain.zendesk.com/home i'm sure the support team will help you.

To resolve this, I added two lines:

```
set_time_limit(0);
ini_set('memory_limit', '-1');
```
